intro: Ischaemum corollatum, commonly known as the white panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along streambanks. Ischaemum corollatum is generally short-lived and reproduces through seeds, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
